intro: Coreopsis latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. Coreopsis latifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
